      • getDefaultNetworkType

        public static NetworkType getDefaultNetworkType(Context context)
        getDefaultNetworkType On the control hub we force the network type into wireless ap mode. On any other device we'll use the stored preference while defaulting to wifi direct.

      • connectedWithUnexpectedDevice

        public boolean connectedWithUnexpectedDevice()
        connectedWithUnexpectedDevice If a driver station is in wireless ap mode, then it always simply connects to a robot controller at the known ip on the same LAN, otherwise compare with the cached connection owner (pulled from preferences). Note this only runs on the driver station.

      • registerPeerStatusCallback

        public boolean registerPeerStatusCallback(PeerStatusCallback callback)
        Register a callback that will notify you when a peer connects, disconnects, or is replaced
        Returns:
        true if a peer was connected at the time of registration

      • handleConnectionInfoAvailable

        public CallbackResult handleConnectionInfoAvailable(SocketConnect socketConnect)
        handleConnectionInfoAvailable We are on a LAN. Do the network setup in SetupRunnable. Since we know we were disconnected prior to this time reset lastRecvPacket so that the command sending thread won't think we are immediately disconnected again.

      • handlePeersAvailable

        public CallbackResult handlePeersAvailable()

      • updateConnection

        public void updateConnection(RobocolDatagram packet)
                      throws RobotCoreException,
                             RobotProtocolException
        updateConnection() We received a peer discovery packet, 'connect' the udp socket so that this endpoint knows who our peer is and start the service that will send datagrams back to the peer. This is symmetric vis-a-vis the RC and DS.
        Throws:
        RobotCoreException
        RobotProtocolException
